VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom.synopsis: Voss arrives at camp and attempts to sway Laezel to his side after the events of the Creche. The Avatar can push Laezel to either agree or stay true to herself, potentially putting her on her Orpheus path.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom.how_to_trigger: Load Act2In Game, these startup params work best for me: -load GustavDev:SCL_Main_A -asserts 0In Game Shipping: -load GustavDev:SCL_Main_AMake sure Laezel is either Companion or AvatarIn Camp Debug Book (CTRL + SHIFT + 8 ) -> Queue Night -> NIGHT_Laezel_VossCampConfrontationLong RestGo to sleep

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB.synopsis: To either the mockery or complete surprise of other gith, Lae’zel now is reconciling the fact she essentially has a relationship with the player going on. She might pretend that it isn’t, call it something else, furiously deny that it is anything like what the humans have… but call it what you will, the hallmarks are unmistakable, and she will eventually admit that she wants this more than anything else.Player can put the idea of Laezel abandoning her duties after the Tadpole problem is over and running away together. This replaces her generic outcast ending with the romance ending. Player can still choose the Vlaakith or Orpheus ending at the end, but also have an option to choose the Romance enging.
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB.how_to_trigger: - queue NIGHT_Laezel_Romance3- Long rest in Lower City and go to bed

ROM_SleepingSecondNight.synopsis: A short black screen that plays instead of the player sleeping cutscene the night that they have sex with Laezel after their SecondNight scene.
ROM_SleepingSecondNight.how_to_trigger: Agree to have sex with Laezel in the SecondNight scene. Go to sleep in the bedroll afterwards. It will play as soon as there are no other higher priority cutscenes.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom.synopsis: Vlaakith offers a last chance for Laezel to do her bidding and kill Orpheus, promising ascension. Player can suggest things, but not sure if it's going to have any long term impact.
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom.how_to_trigger: Camp night becomes available as soon as the player enters Act3.Debug:- queue NIGHT_Laezel_VlaakithVisit- Make sure you have Laezel as Companion- Long rest in WYR_Main_A or CTY_Main_A

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel.synopsis: The player or Laezel can win the combat, resulting in branching at the start Laezel realizes that it's not combat prowess that makes you worth her feelings, but it's all the times you had each other's backs.
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel.how_to_trigger: Finish the battle with Laezel after she wakes you up at night and challenges you to a duel.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar.synopsis: Vlaakith offers a last chance for Laezel to do her bidding and kill Orpheus, promising ascension. Avatar Laezel can speak up against it or agree, but not sure if it's going to have any long term impact.
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar.how_to_trigger: Camp night becomes available as soon as the player enters Act3.Debug:- queue NIGHT_Laezel_VlaakithVisit- Make sure you have Laezel as Avatar- Long rest in WYR_Main_A or CTY_Main_A

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar.synopsis: Voss arrives at camp and attempts to sway Laezel to his side after the events of the Creche.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel SCL_Main_A- using the Camp Debug Book (CTRL + SHIFT + 8), queue NIGHT_Laezel_VossCampConfrontation- with Laezel as an Avatar, do a long rest

SD_AfterCrecheReflection.synopsis: Avatar laezel contemplates everything that happened with Vlaakith at the creche.For cine context, reuse from CAMP_FirstNight_AvD - just laying in bed, thinking.
SD_AfterCrecheReflection.how_to_trigger: Becomes available as a camp night as soon as the Creche Vlaakith encounter is finished.

ROM_SD_Romance2_WokenUpByLaezel.synopsis: Laezel wakes you up in the middle of the night, making it seem at first like she wants sex. Instead, she's looking for a way to convince herself that her feelings towards you are justified and you deserve them. She challenges you to single combat.If the player refuses the duel, the romance with Laezel is ended here.If the players accept, they fight in gameplay and regardless of who wins, a sex scene starts afterwards, branching depending on the outcome.
ROM_SD_Romance2_WokenUpByLaezel.how_to_trigger: - Queue Camp Night Laezel Romance 2 (to be added)- Go to bed

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The player wakes up in the middle of the night to find Kith'rak Voss there, accompanied by one other gith. Voss holds his sword in a seemingly aggressive manner.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_63.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_63.text: Supreme Kith'rak. Has Vlaakith sent you to slay me with your own blade?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_48.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_48.text: I've not come to kill you, Lae'zel. I've come to aid you.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_48.context: NodeContext: Voss should not be menacing here. Turns out he's a good guy. And he should be very charismatic all through this dialogue.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_78.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_78.text: I've not come to kill you, Lae'zel. I've come to aid you.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_78.context: NodeContext: Voss should not be menacing here. Turns out he's a good guy. And he should be very charismatic all through this dialogue.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_24.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_24.text: Tl'a'Vlaakith - has our queen sent a knight to slay me with his own blade?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_57.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_57.text: Such informality, child. Does Jhe'stil Kith'rak not command your respect?
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_57.context: NodeContext: zhe-STILL KITH-rack. Supreme Knight. Fatherly, but not antagonsistically like before.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_31.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_31.text: Your blade speaks for you, kith'rak. You've come for blood.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_1.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_1.text: Child of Gith. I've not come to kill you. I've come to aid you.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_1.context: NodeContext: Voss should not be menacing here. Turns out he's a good guy. And he should be very charismatic all through this dialogue.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss kneels and lays his sword on the ground in the githyanki sign of submission.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_61.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_61.text: Ska'kek kir Gith shabell'eth. My blade rests. Mother Gith compels you to listen.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_61.context: NodeContext: Addressed to Lae'zel. SKA-kek keer gith shah-BELL-eth. 'The word of Gith be present'.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_45.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_45.text: Your cronies tried to kill us. Why should Lae'zel listen to you?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_65.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_65.text: I knew you would fight - and I knew you would win. I needed to ensure Vlaakith's trust. This was the only way.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_50.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_50.text: Fine. We'll hear what you have to say before we gut you.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_6.text: Be at ease. I bring only truth.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_33.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_33.text: I know you carry the Astral Prism, Lae'zel.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_80.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_80.text: Within it lies the seed of Vlaakith's demise. And I intend to help you bring it to fruition.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_56.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_56.text: Vlaakith's demise? Shka'keth. I should run you through for suggesting it.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_77.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_77.text: Are you talking about the person inside? Do you know who that is?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_22.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_22.text: But the one inside's chosen you as an ally, protects you with their power.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_59.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_59.text: That very power will be the end of Vlaakith's tyranny. The Prism's tenant must be let loose.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_9.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_9.text: What are you asking of us, Voss?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_67.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_67.text: I'm asking for your help - and your trust.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_81.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_81.text: You must be either a fool or a hero to work against your own queen.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_49.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_49.text: A fool stumbles without cause. A hero serves a cause without question.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_70.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_70.text: I am neither. 'Clear of heart, clear of mind, and bound by no master.' Now - you must listen.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_19.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_19.text: The Prism's tenant can put an end to Vlaakith's tyranny. They must be let loose.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_53.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_53.text: I've sought their freedom for aeons. When the Prism went missing, I feared the worst.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_23.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_23.text: Instead, you've granted the opportunity I've so long awaited.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_42.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_42.text: All that remains is the key that unchains them - and I've found someone who I believe can provide it.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_41.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_41.text: Bring the Prism to Baldur's Gate. I'll be waiting in a taproom called Sharess' Caress. That is where we decide the fate of my people.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_60.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_60.text: Lae'zel - together we will break our chains, and be Vlaakith's slaves no longer.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_3.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_3.text: I am no slave, Jhe'stil Kith'rak. The Undying Queen is my freedom. It is she who will purify me, and she who will ascend me.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_3.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not too vehement. zhe-STIL KITH-rack.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_58.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_58.text: Lies, Lae'zel - every last one. There is no purification, no ascension.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_35.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_35.text: The zaith'isk does not purify - it extracts memory and kills the infected. Nor does the lich queen glorify the ascended. She feeds on most all of them to grow her power and pursue godhood.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_11.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_11.text: Madness. You flood me with this... this heresy.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Posture in Lae'zel grows aggressive. She raises her blade.NodeContext: Not nearly as aggressive as usual. She believes him but is keeping up appearances.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_75.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_75.text: I... I will hear no more of it.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Posture in Lae'zel grows even more aggressive her blade is still raised.NodeContext: Rising alittle in anger but questioning. She is ready to be convinced. But she has to keep up appearances.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_82.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_82.text: Who is the person inside the Prism?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_2.text: If they have not said, they must have good reason. And I won't be the one to betray them.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_8.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_8.text: He speaks true of the zaith'isk. You need to trust him.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel breathes in sharply, cloises her eyes, lowers her blade, and calms herself. Finally, she has seen through her Queen's lies.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_32.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_32.text: I served Vlaakith the whole of my life. Learned her words, fought her battles, yet she names me Hshar'lak. Your words carry truth.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_32.context: NodeContext: Quietly but with rising determination and consideration. hshar'lak (h-SHAR-lahk) = traitor

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_13.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_13.text: I will meet you in Baldur's Gate. Do not make me regret it.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss takes his blade from the ground and rises.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_74.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_74.text: Lae'zel. I see T'lak'ma Ghir in you - Sister in Freedom. Together, we will be our people's light.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_15.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_15.text: Take this. It is a qua'nith - a psionic detector.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Gives the psionic detectorNodeContext: QUAH-nith

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_51.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_51.text: The queen's warriors hunt you. The qua'nith will sound out when you come near their portals. Hear its cry, and prepare for battle - or slip away.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_18.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_18.text: I should go. Vlaakith's gaze pierces the seas and skies. She believes me loyal - and I can't afford her mistrust.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_29.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_29.text: Keep the Astral Prism close. Let no one take it from you. Slay any who try.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_43.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_43.text: Now - to Baldur's Gate. I'll be waiting, Lae'zel.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss and his companions wave their hands together, and a portal opens before them. They step through and the portals close behind them.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_34.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_34.text: I served Vlaakith the whole of my life. Learned her words, fought her battles. Yet your words carry truth.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_34.context: NodeContext: Quietly but with rising determination and consideration

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_20.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_20.text: What do you want to do Lae'zel? I have your back.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_25.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_25.text: Vlaakith's led you astray. I believe him, and so should you.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_64.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_64.text: Kill him. This is your chance to earn Vlaakith's redemption.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_26.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_26.text: Yes. Yes! I am Vlaakith's will!

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_30.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss grabs his blade from the ground and gears up to attack.NodeContext: Heh-TAH-zith - Die, creature!

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_12.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_12.text: I'm not giving you the Astral Prism, if that's what you're wanting.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_68.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_68.text: I've heard word from Crèche Y'llek. You are infected - yet the one in the Prism has chosen you, protects you with their power.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_66.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_66.text: The Prism's tenant alone has the power to end Vlaakith's tyranny.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_36.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_36.text: Vlaakith is my queen. Why would I want to end her?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_0.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_0.text: Because her throne rests on lies, more than a hundred gish scholars could count in a lifetime. I will share but two.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_46.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_46.context: NodeContext: Unsure of herself, not too vehement.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_37.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_37.text: Your doubt does not make it any less true, child.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_17.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_17.text: Nod to Lae'zel. She should take the lead.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_21.speaker: Player
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_21.text: Your queen hunts us. Why in the hells should we listen to you?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_69.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelCom_69.text: Because I know who you are, and I know about the Astral Prism.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel appears, leaning over the player's bed with a sincere smile, shaking them awake..

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_43.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_43.text: Get up. There's something you should see.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stands from their bed and faces Lae'zel. She straightens out and smiles wider.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_7.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_7.text: I know it's early. But this couldn't wait.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade back in. Player and Lae'zel sit on the roof of the Elfsong Tavern. The sun is just about to rise.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tthe camera moves to show the sun beginning to rise over the horizon. Soft light covers the faces of the player and Lae'zel in a beautiful orange glow.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_9.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_9.text: I used to hate that sight. The glowing sky, the long shadows, the fading stars.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_15.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_15.text: I lived for the red of blood and the black of death. Now I see the colours between.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_63.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_63.text: Look at the sun. What do you see?

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_4.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_4.text: Hope. Life. A future worth fighting for.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_89.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_89.text: The dawn was my torment. Rustling leaves, agony. I couldn't wait to escape this place. Now, I revel in it. I revel in you.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_21.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_21.text: You showed me the betweens and beyonds. Between war and peace, beyond passion and obsession.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_72.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_72.text: Most importantly - you showed me freedom.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_79.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_79.text: There's more, but - but I don't know how to say it. I don't know what to call it. I just know whatever comes next, I want you near.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_87.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_87.text: When all this is over, will you stay with me? For good?

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_48.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_48.text: I've been waiting so long to hear those words. I will stay with you, come what may.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_61.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_61.text: One step at a time. But for now, I'm not going anywhere.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_64.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_64.text: One step, then. Maybe even two - if I should be so lucky.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel reaches her hand towards the player's.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_34.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_34.text: Smile bashfully and keep your hand to yourself.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel smiles back but she does not hold player's hand.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_45.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_45.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj. Source of my joy.
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black after line.NodeContext: ZHAHK vone-fin DOO. Said with love.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_75.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_75.text: I can't take your hand. But I'll gladly look after your heart.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_65.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_65.text: I liked the sex. But I'm not ready for commitment.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_8.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_8.text: I'm not sure, Lae'zel. You can be a lot to handle.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_42.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_42.text: I know. I'm stubborn, I'm rude, I'm pushy. Maybe I always will be. But I'm also loyal and protective and ferocious.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_27.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_27.text: And I've learned other ways, too - the ways of affection and devotion. First, you were my wound; now, you are its cure.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_37.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_37.text: You have taken the whole of me. I could never accept just a piece of you in return.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_2.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_2.text: I just can't say no. You have me for good.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel says nothing but smiles wide. She takes the player's hand and they watch the sun.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_84.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_84.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj. Source of my joy.
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black after line.NodeContext: ZHAHK vone-fin DOO. Said with love.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_46.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel's smile fades. She nods, with slight sadness and stands. She walks away, then looks back over her shoulder.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_28.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_28.text: Zhak vo'n'ash duj. Source of my bruises.
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking back over her shoulder. Fade to black after line.NodeContext: Sadly, but with strength. ZHAHK vo-nahsh DOO.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_60.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_60.text: What a joke. I'm done with this.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_31.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_31.text: A flaming ball in the sky that provides heat and warmth.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_80.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_80.text: Literal - but not wrong. I see something else.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_17.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_17.text: A new day means new battle. I'm in no mood to fawn over sunrises.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_54.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_54.text: Trust me, my bones ache for battle too. But look closer - you might see something else.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_19.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_19.text: You showed them to me. Thank you for that. But - ugh, tsk'va. I thought this would be easier.
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_19.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel about to break up with player

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_10.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_10.text: Go on, say what you have to say.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_38.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_38.text: I can't deny that I feel for you. But you are a - a distraction. I belong to Vlaakith. I cannot be yours. You cannot be mine.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_90.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_90.text: I value you as a friend. As an ally. But my future lies only in the red and the black.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_92.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_92.text: Please, stay with me. I don't want you to go.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_23.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_23.text: Get out of here. I can hardly stand to look at you.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_59.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: At end of line, Lae'zel stands and walks away, then looks back over her shoulder.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_78.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_78.text: It's better this way. Trust me.
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_78.context: CinematicNodeContext: At end of line, Lae'zel stands and walks away, then looks back over her shoulder.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_29.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_29.text: I understand. Your queen must be your priority.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_26.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_26.text: Only in Vlkaakith may I find light.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_77.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_77.text: Really? You've never been short of opinions.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_70.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_70.text: If only you knew how much went unsaid.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_66.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_66.text: You have stirred my soul, and more besides. But I belong to Vlaakith. I cannot be yours. You cannot be mine.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_88.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_88.text: I know what this is. You want to sever our bond.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_76.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_76.text: It's not that I want to. It's that I must.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_0.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_0.text: Everything's fine, trust me. Now come.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel reaches down and pulls the player up from their bed by their hand. Fade to black.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_13.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_13.text: I'm sleeping, Lae'zel. Must you make this a habit?

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_69.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_69.text: I'll make it worth your while. I promise.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_1.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_1.text: Of course. I could never resist you.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_55.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_55.text: All right. This better be good.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel stands from the bed, walks away, then turns back to look at you.

ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_36.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB_36.text: Zhak vo'n'ash duj. Source of my bruises.

ROM_SleepingSecondNight_0.speaker: Narrator
ROM_SleepingSecondNight_0.text: *Lae'zel appears at your bunk, her eyes raging with desire. You suspect you won't be getting much sleep tonight.*
ROM_SleepingSecondNight_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Black screen, only narrator voice visible.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_44.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: [KP] The party enters camp. A moment later, a column of silvery light descends from above. It transforms into a hologram of Vlaakith exactly as seen in the creche moments.NodeContext: With reverence.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_83.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_83.text: I named you Hshar'lak. Yet you still call me Queen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_53.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_53.text: Venerable Vlaakith. Please, I beg you to listen. I seek -
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_53.context: NodeContext: Will be interrupted by Vlaakith

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_94.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_94.text: My forgiveness. Yes, I know - and I might yet grant it.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_113.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_113.text: You carry a ghaik parasite. You harbour the Heretic Prince. Yet so blind is your faith that you still call me Queen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_130.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers. Its power is waning.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_124.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_124.text: I have only a moment. And you, Hshar'lak, will listen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_118.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_118.text: There's little time. I will speak, and you will listen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_96.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_96.text: We are githyanki. We move mountains, we snuff out stars, we shake the planes.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_37.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_37.text: The traitor Voss has lied to you. The Heretic Prince would shatter us in an instant. The Great Dominion, shrunk to the head of a pin.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_92.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_92.text: *Can this be true? Is the githyanki prince really a threat to his own people or simply a challenge to Vlaakith's rule?*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers once more.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_101.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_101.text: Return to the Astral Prism. Slay Orpheus the pretender.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_114.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_114.text: Serve me and I will ascend you. You will be no mere warrior, nor kith'rak. You will be Baht t'Vlaakith.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_138.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_138.text: Commander of Dragons. My only, my Chosen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_98.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_98.text: A final chance. Kneel before me. Make your promise.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_34.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_34.text: Face the facts, Lae'zel. Vlaakith lied to your people. It's time you reject your queen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_139.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_139.text: She - she has good reason, surely. Vlaakith is my faith, my - my very purpose.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_1.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_1.text: Link to Lae'zel's parasite, show her Vlaakith's mind.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_70.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_70.text: No. It can't be. I believed you - I believed everything.
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_70.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel has seen the truth of Vlaakith's lies

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_60.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_60.text: Shka'keth! You speak against the Eternal Queen?

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_134.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_134.text: I gave you my faith, and you called me traitor. I gave you my life, and you ordered your knights to hunt me.
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_134.context: NodeContext: Softly. but gradually more insistent.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_11.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_11.text: Mother Gith's son lives, caged by a prison of your design. Our people deserve the truth - but you have denied it to us.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_33.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_33.text: I have witnessed too much, and you have given me too little. Finally, I can see.
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_33.context: NodeContext: Not vehement, just rising in confidence

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_58.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_58.text: Orpheus will live, and I will hear his creed. This is my word.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_76.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_76.text: Your word is nothing. You are nothing.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_108.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_108.text: The kith'raki will bring you. I will tear your flesh from your bones and devour your skull's marrow while you beg for death.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_43.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_43.text: I will consume you. I will unmake you!
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_43.context: NodeContext: As deranged as possible without having an aneurysm.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith's hologram flickers, then fades away.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_46.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_46.text: Out of my head - the Queen has spoken!

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_2.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_2.text: Poisoned by a life of propaganda. I pity you, Lae'zel.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_3.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_3.text: And I pity your faithless mind.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_80.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_80.text: So the worm bows to the wyvern. Have some dignity, stand up to Vlaakith!

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_123.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_123.text: *Lae'zel's mind reels with images of Vlaakith, the Prism, and the githyanki prince inside it.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_89.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_89.text: I have my dignity. What I do not have is patience for your disloyalty.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_13.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_13.text: Go on, then. Kneel before Vlaakith.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_69.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_69.text: *Your parasites resonate. You feel Lae'zel's ecstasy as she moves to kneel before her queen.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_63.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_63.text: Link to Lae'zel's parasite. Show her Vlaakith's mind.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_27.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_27.text: Use the tadpole. Seek Vlaakith's mind through her psionic conveyance.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_127.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_127.text: *Water and blood. They envelop you, they drag you downward. You are submerged in past, present, and future.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_61.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_61.text: *In this endless sea of understanding, you find truth.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_8.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_8.text: *Lae'zel believes a zaith'isk device cleanses the parasite - but it's used for extracting memories and killing the infected.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_47.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_47.text: *Vlaakith does not welcome her finest young warriors into her royal city to reward them, but to consume their essence in her quest for godhood.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_30.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_30.text: *The lich queen doesn't intend to reward Lae'zel, but to devour her. Vlaakith speaks only in lies.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_65.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_65.text: *In this endless sea of understanding, you find truth. There is no cleansing, no ascension, no Chosen. Vlaakith will take Lae'zel's life essence for herself.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_67.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_67.text: *Your mind spins, your heart races. There is only endless void - and you are caught in the Undying Queen's orbit.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_39.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Resounding only in player's head. The player grips their head in pain.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_110.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_110.text: Damned fool. The wretched cannot sway the divine!

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel kneels to the Vlaakith hologram.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_105.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_105.text: Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith. Your grace is my honour. Orpheus will die by my hand - and I will take my rightful place at your side.
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_105.context: NodeContext: cheh-MAR ZAL-ah VLAH-kith. Vlaakith's will above all

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_9.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_9.text: One promise. One drop in the Astral Sea.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_23.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_23.text: Do not fail me. For you would not survive the flood to follow.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel rises and the hologram flickers away

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_35.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_35.text: Voss was right, Vlaakith is your slaver. Denounce her - you must walk free.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_90.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_90.text: I will not entertain madness. Only in Vlaakith's might am I free!

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_91.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_91.text: Go on, Lae'zel. Kneel before your god-queen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_137.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_137.text: *Lae'zel's thoughts become yours. The sight of Orpheus looms over her mind; Voss' words echo within it. She means to forever turn her back on Vlaakith.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_42.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_42.text: Kneel, Lae'zel. To be the god-queen's Chosen is an extraordinary honour.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_112.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_112.text: No. I have not cast off my chains only to be rebound.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_73.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_73.text: Connect with Lae'zel's parasite. 'Commander of Dragons. This is your destiny.'

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_45.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_45.text: *Lae'zel's doubts turn to rapture as she considers an eternity as Vlaakith's Chosen.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_106.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_106.text: Baht t'Vlaakith. No githyanki's held the honour. My faith, almost lost to the dark winds -

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_117.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_117.text: How incredible, for them to carry it back.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_100.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_100.text: Stand your ground. Don't fall for Vlaakith's lies.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_64.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_64.text: The Heretic Prince would shatter us in an instant. The Great Dominion, shrunk to the head of a pin.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_28.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: [KP] The party enters camp. A moment later, a column of silvery light descends from above. It transforms into a hologram of Vlaakith exactly as seen in the creche moments.NodeContext: Feels betrayed by Vlaakith. Stands atraight and defiant. (tsk-VA)

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_81.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_81.text: You are Hshar'lak. And still you speak my name.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_135.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_135.text: Vin'iisk. I am your Queen! Would you not bend in my honour?

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_48.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_48.text: Raise your eyes. Look upon She Who Conquers.
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: The party enters camp. A moment later, a column of silvery light descends from above. It transforms into a hologram of Vlaakith exactly as seen in the creche moments.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_4.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_4.text: Who in the Hells are you?

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_17.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_17.context: NodeContext: her facade splinters a little, letting her mad, immortal rage take over

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_56.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_56.text: I am Vlaakith. Undying Queen of the noble githyanki. God Regent of the Six Arms of Tu'narath.
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_56.context: NodeContext: anger should build rhythmically here, each consonant semi-spat in rage

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_88.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_88.text: And you - you are abominations twice over. You carry ghaik parasites. And you harbour the Heretic Prince Orpheus.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_74.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_74.text: I've seen the captive Orpheus with my own eyes, spoken to Jhe'stil Kith'rak Voss. You lied to us, enslaved us.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_15.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_15.context: NodeContext: Absolute bonkers nuts for just a moment.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_6.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_6.text: Glorious Vlaakith. I am unclean. I exhort you, grant me guidance.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_79.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_79.text: Return to the Astral Prism. Slay Orpheus the pretender.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_119.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_119.text: Kneel before me. Make your promise.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_20.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_20.text: Get out of my camp. You're not welcome here.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_111.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_111.text: The Mistress of Castle Susurrus does not require invitation.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_115.speaker: Player
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_115.text: Look upon the figure with reverence.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_59.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelCom_59.text: Vlaakith tavki na'zin. I am truth.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The player has been defeated by Lae'zel. They are kneeling, clutching their belly. Lae'zel stands in front of them victorious but upset.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_35.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_35.context: NodeContext: Not mad - panicked. She has truly hurt the one she likes

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel crouches and pulls the short player up by their hands.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_67.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_67.text: *Lae'zel's touch is unusually gentle. Her fingers lightly graze your bruises and wipe away your sweat.*
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel gently caresses the short player's face and neck.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_63.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_63.text: *Lae'zel's touch is unusually gentle. Her fingers lightly graze your bruises and wipe away your sweat.*
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel gently caresses the player's face and neck.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_51.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_51.text: No more. I can't bear it.
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_51.context: NodeContext: With panic and concern for the player.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_45.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_45.text: I've torn flesh from monsters and men. I've laughed as they suffered. But you -
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_45.context: NodeContext: With concern for the player.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_43.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_43.text: I don't want to hurt you - I want to protect you. For you to protect me.
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_43.context: NodeContext: With concern for the player. Coming to a realisation of her feelings for the player.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_38.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_38.context: NodeContext: Coming to a realisation of her feelings for the player. But not too plaintive, very subtle.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_0.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_0.context: NodeContext: Coming to a realisation of her feelings for the player. But not too plaintive, very subtle.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_24.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_24.text: Pull her close. Press your lips against hers.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel is on her knees, holding her belly after losing combat.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_7.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_7.text: Take her hand and pull her up.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The player pulls Lae'zel up from her kneeling position, and they face each other.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_6.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_6.text: I should be humiliated. I should know the shame of defeat. I am Lae'zel -
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_6.context: NodeContext: Said with growing passion for the player

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_46.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_46.text: Take her hand and pull her up.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_66.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_66.text: Save your compliments. I won't accept them.
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_66.context: NodeContext: Stinging from being beaten in combat, but passionate towards the player

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_75.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_75.text: Smile and pull Lae'zel to the ground.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The player tackles Lae'zel and they fall to the ground. Their faces are an inch away from each other.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_65.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_65.text: Zhak vo'n'ash duj. Source of my bruises.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Player on top of Lae'zel - the two kiss. Fade to black.NodeContext: ZHAHK vo-nahsh DOO. With great physical passion

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player and Lae'zel kiss, and then pull apart.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_71.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_71.text: Zhak vo'n'ash duj. Source of my bruises.
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_71.context: NodeContext: As romantic as it gets for Lae'zel. ZHAHK vo-nahsh DOO.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel and the player pull each other close and continue their kiss. Fade to black.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The short player and Lae'zel kiss, and then pull apart.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_42.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_42.text: Zhak vo'n'ash duj. Source of my bruises.
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_42.context: NodeContext: As romantic as it gets for Lae'zel. ZHAHK vo-nahsh DOO.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel and the short player pull each other close and continue their kiss. Fade to black.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_60.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_60.text: This is the mighty Lae'zel? What an embarrassment. You've gone soft.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_9.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel stares at the player for a moment, and then smiles.NodeContext: Smiling.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Player tackles Lae'zel and they fall to the ground, faces close.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_23.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_23.text: Zhak vo'n'ash duj. Source of my bruises.
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_23.context: NodeContext: With great passion. ZHAHK vo-nahsh DOO.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel pushes her lips to the players and they kiss. Fade to black.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The player turns their back and walks away. We see Lae'zels blank face, and then fade to black.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_81.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel's face slowly hardens before she speaks. She opened herself up. It will never happen again.NodeContext: Hardened but the slightest hint of dejection.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_39.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_39.context: NodeContext: Hardened but the slightest hint of dejection.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_29.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_29.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel walks away from player, but turns her head a moment later.

Lae'zel looking back to player.NodeContext: A little softer in attitude. She is calling the player that just rejected them by the pet name she secretly gave them.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel turns and faces forward, away from the player. She walks away and fade to black.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_49.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_49.text: Yet I cannot take of your flesh, of your body. I can withstand anything in the realms, but not the fire in you.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_18.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_18.text: I cannot master you. I cannot even try.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_78.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_78.text: I am made malleable by the flames in you. By the inferno of the Hells. But I cannot touch you. I can have no part of you - none!

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_72.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_72.context: NodeContext: Stinging from being beaten in combat, but passionate towards the player

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_40.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_40.text: But I also didn't doubt me.
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_40.context: NodeContext: Stinging from being beaten in combat, but passionate towards the player

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_14.speaker: Player
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_14.text: Pathetic. That's the best you could do?

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_28.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_28.text: It was. Your wounds are your proof.
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_28.context: NodeContext: Stinging from being beaten in combat, but passionate towards the player

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel rises to her feet. She and the player face each other.

ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_44.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_44.text: You were stronger. I was steel, and you were silver.
ROM_Romance2_AfterDuel_44.context: NodeContext: Complimenting the player. Passionate for player

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: The party enters camp. A moment later, a column of silvery light descends from above. It transforms into a hologram of Vlaakith exactly as seen in the creche moments.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_21.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_21.text: Raise your eyes. Look upon She Who Conquers.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_49.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_49.text: *The projection exudes immense psionic energy. Only five thousand senja'si and five thousand gish, gathered in Tu'narath, could convey such an image.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_32.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_32.text: I named you Hshar'lak. Yet you still call me Queen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_46.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_46.text: Yes, I see it. A flicker of faith. You yearn for purity and mercy. You yearn for a place in Tu'narath still.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_6.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_6.text: You are Hshar'lak. And still you speak my name.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_11.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_11.text: Insolent. Ignorant. But I know a flicker of faith still burns inside you.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_30.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_30.text: You yearn for purity and mercy. You yearn for a place in Tu'narath still.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_78.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_78.text: You may yet have it. For I am not wholly without pity.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_31.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_31.text: Tell me. What must I do to regain your trust?

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_44.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_44.text: Your word. Your faith. Your eternal promise in exchange for mine.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers. Its power is waning.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_13.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_13.text: I have only a moment. And you, Hshar'lak, will listen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_22.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_22.text: Mother Gith made us a city. I made us an empire. We move mountains, we snuff out stars, we shake the planes.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_25.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_25.text: The traitor Voss has lied to you. The Heretic Prince would shatter us in an instant. The Great Dominion, shrunk to the head of a pin.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_23.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_23.text: *Can this be true? Is Prince Orpheus really such a threat to your people or simply a challenge to Vlaakith's rule?*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers once more.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_57.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_57.text: Find a way into the Prism. Slay Orpheus. All will be made right.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_76.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_76.text: I will cleanse your infection. I will ascend you. You will be no mere warrior, nor kith'rak. You will be Baht t'Vlaakith.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_24.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_24.text: Commander of Dragons. My only. My Chosen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_47.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_47.text: A final chance. Kneel before me. Make your promise.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_28.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_28.text: Use the tadpole. Seek Vlaakith's mind through her psionic conveyance.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_59.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_59.text: *Water and blood. They envelop you, they drag you downward. You are submerged in past, present, and future.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_39.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_39.text: *In this endless sea of understanding, you find truth.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_58.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_58.text: *The zaith'isk device doesn't cleanse the parasite - it's used for extracting memories and killing the infected.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_38.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_38.text: *Vlaakith does not welcome her finest young warriors into her royal city to reward them, but to consume their essence in her quest for godhood.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_52.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_52.text: *The lich queen doesn't intend to reward you, but to devour you. She speaks only in lies.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_19.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_19.text: *In this endless sea of understanding, you find truth. There is no cleansing, no ascension, no Chosen. You are Vlaakith's pawn, and nothing more.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_9.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_9.text: *Your mind spins, your heart races. There is only endless void, an ocean of grey and violet.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_70.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_70.text: Kneel before Vlaakith. Promise to slay Orpheus.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Lae'zel kneels before Vlaakith.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_29.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_29.text: One promise. One drop in the Astral Sea.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_68.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_68.text: Do not fail me. For you would not survive the flood to follow.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel rises and the hologram flickers away

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_20.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_20.text: No. I will not kill Orpheus for you.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_72.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_72.text: The kith'raki will bring you. I will tear your flesh from your bones and devour your skull's marrow while you beg for death.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_17.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_17.text: I will consume you. I will unmake you!
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_17.context: NodeContext: As deranged as possible without having an aneurysm.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith's hologram flickers, then fades away.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_69.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_69.text: I have seen the truth. I reject you, Queen of Lies - I will not be your puppet.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_41.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_41.text: I am Vlaakith. Undying Queen of the noble githyanki. God Regent of the Six Arms of Tu'narath.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_71.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_71.text: The Heretic Prince would shatter us in an instant. The Great Dominion, shrunk to the head of a pin.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_36.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_36.text: *Can the Heretic Prince really be such a threat to your queen's rule? He is a prisoner, shackled, impotent.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_12.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_12.text: Get to the point. Why are you here?

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_53.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_53.text: I am sovereign of the Astral Plane, Queen Regent of the City of Death. You could ask any question, yet you choose only the obvious.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_10.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_10.text: I don't want your pity. I don't want your mercy. I want you gone from this place.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_66.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_66.text: I am the Eternal Empress, she who presides over the One in the Void. I do not require an invitation.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_73.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_73.text: Tsk'va. I should have expected no better from Hshar'lak.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Extra cine node to allow more time for the previous cinematics to play.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_5.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_5.text: Vlaakith tavki na'zin. I am truth.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_27.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_27.text: And you - you are an abomination twice over. You carry a ghaik parasite. And you harbour the Heretic Prince Orpheus.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_81.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_81.text: I have only a moment. And you, vin'iisk, will listen.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_63.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_63.text: *Your queen has bridged the planes to meet with you. An act of great power, but what drives it - authority or fear?*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_2.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_2.text: *Prince Orpheus may be a threat to your people as she claims, or perhaps, a threat to her rule.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_8.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_8.text: Find a way into the Astral Prism. Slay Orpheus the pretender.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_43.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_43.text: Kneel before me. Make your promise.

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_77.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_77.text: *Your queen is terrible and mighty as you ever dreamed. It seems unfathomable that she could be afraid of an imprisoned, impotent prince.*

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_7.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_7.text: A projection this powerful? Impossible - isn't it?

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_26.speaker: Vlaakith
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_26.text: Five thousand senja'si, five thousand gish - gathered in Tu'narath. They convey my essence through a single psionic thread.
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_26.context: NodeContext: sen-JAH-see, gish. (Sorcerers) / TOO-nah-rahth (gith capital city)

VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_40.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithVisit_CFM_LaezelAvatar_40.text: Vlaakith? Get out of my camp. You're not welcome here.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player wakes up in the middle of the night to find Kith'rak Voss there, accompanied by one other gith. Voss holds his sword in a seemingle aggressive manner.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.text: Child of Gith. Or should I say - Hshar'lak?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_8.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_8.text: Supreme Kith'rak. Has Vlaakith sent you to slay me with your own blade?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.text: I've not come to kill you, Lae'zel. I've come to aid you.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.context: NodeContext: Voss should not be menacing here. Turns out he's a good guy. And he should be very charismatic all through this dialogue.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.text: I've not come to kill you, child. I've come to aid you.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.context: NodeContext: Voss should not be menacing here. Turns out he's a good guy. And he should be very charismatic all through this dialogue.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.text: He's trying to corrupt you with lies - we need to get rid of him.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss kneels and lays his sword on the ground in the githyanki sign of submission.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.text: Ska'kek kir Gith shabell'eth. My blade rests. Mother Gith compels you to listen.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.context: NodeContext: Addressed to Lae'zel. SKA-kek keer gith shah-BELL-eth. 'The word of Gith be present'.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.text: Your cronies tried to kill us. Why should I listen to you?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.text: I knew you would fight - and I knew you would win. I needed to ensure Vlaakith's trust. This was the only way.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.text: I know you carry the Astral Prism, Lae'zel.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.text: Fine. I'll hear what you have to say before I gut you.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.text: Be at ease. I bring only truth.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.text: Speak. You have my ear, as Mother Gith taught us.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.text: My own queen hunts me. Why in the hells should I listen to you?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.text: I am no servant of Queen Vlaakith. But I know who you are, and I know of the Astral Prism you carry.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.text: Within it lies the seed of Vlaakith's demise. And I intend to help you bring it to fruition.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.text: Who is this 'seed of Vlaakith's demise'?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.text: But the one inside's chosen you as an ally, protects you with their power.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.text: That very power will be the end of Vlaakith's tyranny. The Prism's tenant must be let loose.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.text: What are you asking of me, Voss?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_8.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_8.text: I'm asking for your help - and your trust.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.text: A kith'rak resists the Undying Queen? That either makes you a fool - or a hero.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.text: A fool stumbles without cause. A hero serves a cause without question.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.text: I am neither. 'Clear of heart, clear of mind, and bound by no master.' Now - you must listen.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.text: The Prism's tenant can put an end to Vlaakith's tyranny. They must be let loose.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.text: I'm not giving you the Astral Prism, if that's what you're wanting.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_8.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_8.text: I've heard word from Crèche Y'llek. You are infected - yet the one in the Prism has chosen you, protects you with their power.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.text: The Prism's tenant alone has the power to end Vlaakith's tyranny. They must be let loose.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.text: I've sought their freedom for aeons. When the Prism went missing, I feared the worst.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.text: Instead, you've granted the opportunity I've so long awaited.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.text: All that remains is the key that unchains them - and I've found someone who I believe can provide it.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_8.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_8.text: Bring the Prism to Baldur's Gate. I'll be waiting in a taproom called Sharess' Caress. That is where we decide the fate of our people.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.text: Lae'zel - together we will break our chains, and be Vlaakith's slaves no longer.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.text: I am no slave. It is Vlaakith who will purify me and ascend me.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not too vehement. zhe-STIL KITH-rack.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_8.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_8.text: Lies, Lae'zel - every last one. There is no purification, no ascension.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.text: The zaith'isk does not purify - it extracts memory and kills the infected. Nor does the lich queen glorify the ascended. She feeds on most all of them to grow her power and pursue godhood.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.speaker: Narrator
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.text: *Ascension - the foundation of githyanki belief. Bring Queen Vlaakith an illithid's head, and she will grant you an eternal home in the great city of Tu'narath.*

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.speaker: Narrator
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.text: *This has been your life's purpose. Could Vlaakith truly intend to consume your life force to strengthen her own?*

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.text: Who is the person inside the Prism?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.text: If they have not said, they must have good reason. And I won't be the one to betray them.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.text: I'll let you leave this camp alive. But I can promise nothing more.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.text: Take this. It is a qua'nith - a psionic detector.
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Gives the psionic detectorNodeContext: QUAH-nith

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_9.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_9.text: The queen's warriors hunt you. The qua'nith will sound out when you come near their portals. Hear its cry, and prepare for battle - or slip away.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.text: I should go. Vlaakith's gaze pierces the seas and skies. She believes me loyal - and I can't afford her mistrust.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.text: Keep the Astral Prism close. Let no one take it from you. Slay any who try.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_7.text: Now - to Baldur's Gate. I'll be waiting, Lae'zel.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss and his companions wave their hands together, and a portal opens before them. They step through and the portals close behind them.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.text: Your words carry truth - I will meet you in Baldur's Gate.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Voss takes his blade from the ground and rises.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.text: Lae'zel. I see T'lak'ma Ghir in you - Sister in Freedom. Together, we will be our people's light.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.text: I will not abandon my queen. Die, kith'rak!

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss grabs his blade from the ground and gears up to attack.NodeContext: Heh-TAH-zith - Die, creature!

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.text: Vlaakith's demise? I should run you through for suggesting it.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_1.text: Because her throne rests on lies, more than a hundred gish scholars could count in a lifetime. I will share but two.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.text: I've heard enough. Taste my fury, kith'rak.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.text: No more words. This camp will be your grave.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_5.text: A kith'rak. Has our Queen sent you to slay me yourself?

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.text: At ease, child. Jhe'stil Kith'rak does not come to kill you -
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.context: NodeContext: zhe-STILL KITH-rack. Supreme Knight. Fatherly, but not antagonsistically like before.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_2.text: I am not Hshar'lak. You must hear me - Vlaakith has abandoned us.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.text: You make a dangerous accusation. Vlaakith would call your words heresy.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_4.text: Honoured kith'rak. Tell me you bring me Vlaakith's forgiveness.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.text: Forgiveness? Ignorant child. In Vlaakith, there is no forgiveness. You might as well beg a dragon for its wings.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_3.text: I do not bring her mercy. I bring you the truth.

VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.speaker: Lae'zel
VossCampConfrontation_SCO_LaezelAvatar_6.text: Enjoy your next breath. It will be your last.

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_8.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_8.text: *'I know a secret that Vlaakith never wants to be revealed.'*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_43.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_43.text: *What secret could be so ruinous to the Undying Queen of the Six Arms of Tu'narath?*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_38.speaker: Lae'zel
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_38.text: This secret is not yours to know. You will return the Astral Prism to Vlaakith and regain her favour.

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_66.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_66.text: *But even in reverie, doubt gnaws at you like a tadpole at its host.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_51.speaker: Lae'zel
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_51.text: There's no telling - but your people have turned on you. Vlaakith is afraid of being found out.

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_70.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_70.text: *As a young warrior on K'liir, you devoted your life to your queen.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_24.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_24.text: *You were taught that she would reward her most vicious adepts with ascension - an invitation to the imperial city of Tu'narath.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_26.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_26.text: *Now, doubt gnaws at you like a tadpole at its host.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_46.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_46.text: *Your people seek your head, just as the dream figure warned. Whatever this secret, Vlaakith will kill her own faithful to keep it.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_16.speaker: Lae'zel
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_16.text: Lies, every word of it. Ghaik trickery played on you by the parasite in your head.

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_21.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_21.text: *'Queen Vlaakith is lying to you and your people.'*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_37.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_37.text: *These were the words of your dream figure. Not long ago, they pierced the ethereal stillness of the Astral Plane.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_55.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_55.text: *Blasphemous words, looming as large in your mind as the towering figure of Vlaakith herself.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_18.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_18.text: *Could the Undying Queen truly be powerless against the Illithid Empire, as the dream figure said?*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_7.speaker: Lae'zel
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_7.text: Heresy. Your queen bears the might of the Astral Sea. The ghaik are no threat to the githyanki.

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_44.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_44.text: *Your mind bursts with vicious images of githyanki knights tearing through scores of mind flayers.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_3.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_3.text: *Silver swords stained with shimmering ghaik blood - a comforting notion. Your queen is eternal and your people untouchable.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_10.speaker: Lae'zel
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_10.text: If the figure holds the power to resist illithid control, you must return it to Vlaakith.

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_59.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_59.text: *Such a feat would surely earn your queen's most gracious blessings.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_1.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_1.text: *You would wield a silver sword, ride a red dragon of your own. You would not just be ascended - you would be kith'rak.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_5.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_5.text: *Yet even within reverie, the figure's final words penetrate as a silver sword into illithid flesh:*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_22.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_22.text: *'You were on the right path - to Moonrise Towers. Return to it.'*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_9.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_9.text: *Moonrise is your destiny. That is where the truth will finally out.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_67.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_67.text: *'You must go to Moonrise Towers. That is where the cultists are gathering.'*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_25.speaker: Lae'zel
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_25.text: This figure is protecting you from the Absolute. They are an ally - and worth hearing out.

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_19.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_19.text: *But now? Now, doubt gnaws at your skull like a tadpole gnaws at its host.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_50.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_50.text: *If the ghaik empire should rise - if the Grand Design were to transpire - it could be the doom of your people.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_17.speaker: Lae'zel
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_17.text: The zaith'isk failed. Your people have turned on you. There must be truth in the figure's words.

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_36.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_36.text: *As a young warrior on K'liir, you'd never once questioned your queen.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_4.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_4.text: *Her words were carved in slate and her figure carved in granite. She was silver, she was iron, she was your reason for being.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_2.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_2.text: *You gave her everything - yet she's turned your own people against you, just as the dream figure warned.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_23.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_23.text: *Vlaakith is afraid. Afraid of what you might discover. Afraid of you. And your most reliable ally lives inside the Prism you carry.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_32.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_32.text: *The figure bid you to journey to Moonrise Towers. That is your destiny. That is where the truth will finally out.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_45.speaker: Lae'zel
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_45.text: Your people have turned on you. There must be truth in the figure's words.

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_12.speaker: Lae'zel
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_12.text: Lies, every word of it. Ghaik trickery played on you by the parasite in your head.

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_62.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_62.text: *You breathe slowly and deeply, seeking refuge from the figure's deceit in the words of the sacred Tla'ket.*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_41.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterCrecheReflection_41.text: *'Vlaakith, show us truth. Vlaakith, make me pure. Vlaakith, I seek entry. Vlaakith, I am reborn.'*

SD_AfterCrecheReflection_28.speaker: Narrator
